answers.q: what is the formula for sodium sulfite
answers.a: Na2SO3; it’s also commonly available as the heptahydrate Na2SO3·7H2O.

answers.q: what is the chemical formula for sodium sulfite
answers.a: Na2SO3 (sodium sulfite), sometimes encountered as the heptahydrate Na2SO3·7H2O.

answers.q: what is sodium sulfite used for
answers.a: It’s an antioxidant/preservative that prevents browning and oxidation and helps stabilize color and flavor in foods like dried fruits and potatoes; in wine it also helps control unwanted microbes.

answers.q: "sodium sulfite as a preservative is not allowed on what foods"
answers.a: In the U.S., sulfiting agents like sodium sulfite are not allowed on fresh fruits and vegetables intended to be served or sold raw to consumers (e.g., salad bars, fresh-cut produce).
